TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {1290=Jon, Hollywood 09/01/2013, 873=Praise be to whichever non-denominational deities watch over the hopes and dreams of the power-popping masses. Nothing Can Hurt Me, a documentary about the tragic life and times of America's ultimate power-pop masters, came out in 2012 and was filled with new and unheard mixes of classic songs from the Big Star catalogue along with never before released recordings, demos, and tracks from the tangential solo albums of the band's members. Originally released as a 2013 Record Store Day exclusive, this compilation makes those songs available for the first time and should appeal to both Big Star completists and newcomers, offering stunning versions of canonized favorites to woo anyone bitten by the Big Star bug., 944=06/24/2013}

textBeforeTable: Track Listing Praise be to whichever non-denominational deities watch over the hopes and dreams of the power-popping masses. Nothing Can Hurt Me, a documentary about the tragic life and times of America's ultimate power-pop masters, came out in 2012 and was filled with new and unheard mixes of classic songs from the Big Star catalogue along with never before released recordings, demos, and tracks from the tangential solo albums of the band's members. Originally released as a 2013 Record Store Day exclusive, this compilation makes those songs available for the first time and should appeal to both Big Star completists and newcomers, offering stunning versions of canonized favorites to woo anyone bitten by the Big Star bug. 06/24/2013 In all its spavined, deshabille, and perma-faded glory. Like all stellar phenomena, their incandescence directly proportional to their evanescence; their image more renowned from pallid reflections than direct inspection. Jon, Hollywood 09/01/2013 Amoeba Review CD Also available in: SHIPS FREE in U.S. $24.98 BUY Big Star Nothing Can Hurt Me (LP)
